result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul D. Jacobsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $518 DOC Collect; If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact directly or indirectly with victims, or V.J. their residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere, without permission of Agent.

Any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary.
Follow through with all caregivers recommendations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Paul D. Jacobsen in court with attorney Brian William Severson.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders: sentence withheld: 4 years Probation concurrent with 15CF1940, Testing and Treatment as deemed necessary, follow through with all caregivers recommendations, $510 costs DOC Collect; IMPOSED and STAYED: 90 days RCJail, No contact with victims, employment or residence without permission of agent; No contact with V.J., 1 day credit if Revoked.
